question: Does clathrin stabilize kinetochore fibers of the mitotic spindle during mitosis to promote chromosome congression? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Here, we show that clathrin stabilizes fibres of the mitotic spindle to aid congression of chromosomes.
content.source_2: Depletion of clathrin heavy chain using RNA interference did not prolong mitosis; kinetochore fibres remained stable, chromosomes congressed efficiently to the metaphase plate, and the spindle checkpoint showed no persistent activation.
content.source_3: Normal mitosis was rescued by overexpression of the N-terminal domain of clathrin heavy chain, whereas reintroduction of clathrin triskelia was dispensable, indicating that stabilization of kinetochore fibres is independent of clathrinâ€™s triskelion architecture.
